articles.title: Denise A. Piechnik
articles.contents:
DENISE PIECHNIK

          Denise A. Piechnik

          Bio
          Denise Piechnik is a certified ecologist (ESA 2023) with
          research experience in the sub-disciplines of conservation,
          aquatic biology, entomology, and ecosystem ecology. She has
          over 20 years of experience in research, experimental design,
          statistical analysis, technical writing, and teaching.
          Current interests are in positions and opportunities to use
          data and analytical techniques to solve problems with planning
          and implementing sustainability practices.
          
          
          Education - degrees held
          University of California, Davis | Davis,
          California
          PhD Ecology | Aug 1999 - Sept 2007
          San Francisco State University | San
          Francisco, California
          B.S in Biology (Ecology) | Aug 1992 - May 1995
          
          
          Experience
          University of Pittsburgh at Bradford |
          Associate Professor of Biology (tenured) | Sept 2013 -
          (present - sabbatical)
          The Pennsylvania State University |
          Post-doctoral Scholar - Conservation Practices in Northeastern
          Grazing Lands | April 2009 - Dec 2011
          The Pennsylvania State University |
          Research Associate (post-doc) - Analysis of Arthropod
          Diversity in Gettysburgh Military National Park | April 2007 -
          Jan 2009
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Denise A. Piechnik
